thread.title: Re: Angara: Ensuring De Lima’s safety a test for Duterte admin
thread.title_full: Re: Angara: Ensuring De Lima’s safety a test for Duterte admin

author: joseal
title: Re: Angara: Ensuring De Lima’s safety a test for Duterte admin
text:
Angara: Ensuring De Lima’s safety a test for Duterte admin ‘WE HOPE SHE’S ACCORDED DUE PROCESS,’ SAYS SONNY INQUIRER.net / 12:54 PM February 27, 2017 Senator Juan Edgardo “Sonny” Angara. PRIB/ROMEO BUGANTE 
Sen. Juan Edgardo “Sonny” Angara on Monday said it is a test for the administration of President Rodrigo Duterte to ensure the safety of its staunchest critic Sen. Leila de Lima, who is currently detained over drug charges. READ: De Lima arrives at Camp Crame after arrest 
“Sen. De Lima is a colleague and she’s entitled to all the protection that our justice system accords to Filipino citizen. We hope she’s accorded due process. We hope her security and safety are assured,” Angara said in a Meet Inquirer Multimedia forum. 
“I think it’s a test also for the administration to ensure that she’s safe, because if something happens to her, then who’s the number one suspect? It will appear that there’s an effort to harm her. There’s a lot at stake for everyone here,” Angara added. ADVERTISEMENT 
De Lima’s allies including former President Benigno Aquino III have expressed concern over her safety under the custody of the Philippine National Police, bringing up the murder of South Korean businessman Jee Ick-joo inside the police headquarters. 
De Lima is currently detained at the PNP Custodial Center at Camp Crame after she was ordered arrested by the Muntinlupa Regional Trial Court for her alleged involvement in the illegal drug trade at the New Bilibid Prison when she was Justice secretary. She has repeatedly denied all allegations being hurled against her and dismissed them as political vendetta. RAM
